CC1.1.name: Board Oversight
CC1.1.description: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal control.

requirements.name: Corporate Governance Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Corporate Governance Policy that defines board oversight responsibilities, roles, review frequency, and reporting requirements.

requirements.name: Board Oversight Procedures
requirements.description: Documented procedures for board oversight, including scheduled reviews, risk assessments, and communication channels with management.

requirements.name: Board Meeting Documentation
requirements.description: Minutes of board meetings and oversight reports demonstrating active review of internal controls.

CC1.2.name: Management Philosophy
CC1.2.description: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

requirements.name: Corporate Governance Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Corporate Governance Policy that outlines management responsibilities and the organizational structure for effective oversight.

requirements.name: Management Oversight Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for management oversight, including decision-making processes and periodic reporting.

requirements.name: Management Control Training
requirements.description: Training for management on internal control responsibilities and ethical decision-making.

requirements.name: Management Structure Documentation
requirements.description: Organizational charts, management meeting minutes, and training records.

CC1.3.name: Organizational Structure
CC1.3.description: The organization demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.

requirements.name: Human Resources Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Human Resources Policy that defines recruitment, retention, and competency requirements.

requirements.name: Talent Management Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for talent acquisition, performance management, and professional development.

requirements.name: HR Documentation
requirements.description: HR records, training logs, and performance evaluations.

CC1.4.name: Personnel Policies
CC1.4.description: The organization holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

requirements.name: Human Resources Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Human Resources Policy that outlines roles, responsibilities, and disciplinary measures.

requirements.name: Personnel Accountability Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for monitoring, enforcing, and reviewing personnel accountability.

requirements.name: Control Responsibility Training
requirements.description: Mandatory training on internal control responsibilities and ethical conduct.

requirements.name: Personnel Compliance Documentation
requirements.description: Employee acknowledgment forms, training records, and disciplinary documentation.

CC1.5.name: Code of Conduct
CC1.5.description: The organization demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values.

requirements.name: Corporate Governance Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Corporate Governance Policy (or a dedicated Code of Conduct within it) that defines ethical behavior and compliance expectations.

requirements.name: Ethics Compliance Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for reporting, investigating, and addressing breaches of the code.

requirements.name: Ethics Training
requirements.description: Regular ethics and integrity training for all employees.

requirements.name: Ethics Compliance Documentation
requirements.description: Signed acknowledgment forms, training completion records, and records of investigations or disciplinary actions.

CC2.1.name: Information Quality
CC2.1.description: The organization obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal control.

requirements.name: Information Security Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that outlines data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness requirements.

requirements.name: Data Quality Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for validating data inputs and correcting errors throughout data processing.

requirements.name: Data Quality Documentation
requirements.description: Data quality reports, audit logs, and records of corrective actions.

CC2.2.name: Internal Communication
CC2.2.description: The organization internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control.

requirements.name: Corporate Governance Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Corporate Governance Policy that includes guidelines for internal communications of control objectives.

requirements.name: Internal Communication Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for internal reporting, announcements, and feedback regarding internal controls.

requirements.name: Communication Records
requirements.description: Communication logs, email distributions, and meeting minutes.

CC2.3.name: External Communication
CC2.3.description: The organization communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

requirements.name: Corporate Governance Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Corporate Governance Policy that outlines external communication guidelines for control-related matters.

requirements.name: External Communication Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for drafting, approving, and disseminating external communications related to internal controls.

requirements.name: External Communication Records
requirements.description: Records of external communications, press releases, and stakeholder correspondence.

CC3.1.name: Risk Assessment Process
CC3.1.description: The organization specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.

requirements.name: Risk Management Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Risk Management Policy that defines methodologies, frequency, and scope for risk assessments.

requirements.name: Risk Assessment Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for conducting regular risk assessments, documenting risks, and assigning risk owners.

requirements.name: Risk Assessment Documentation
requirements.description: Risk assessment reports, risk registers, and management review minutes.

CC3.2.name: Risk Identification
CC3.2.description: The organization identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.

requirements.name: Risk Management Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Risk Management Policy requiring systematic identification of risks across all business areas.

requirements.name: Risk Identification Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for risk identification using workshops, surveys, and data analysis.

requirements.name: Risk Identification Records
requirements.description: Risk register entries, workshop records, and risk analysis documentation.

CC3.3.name: Fraud Risk Assessment
CC3.3.description: The organization considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

requirements.name: Risk Management Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Risk Management Policy with provisions for assessing and mitigating fraud risks.

requirements.name: Fraud Risk Assessment Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for conducting fraud risk assessments and reporting findings.

requirements.name: Fraud Risk Documentation
requirements.description: Fraud risk assessment reports, internal audit findings, and remediation tracking records.

CC3.4.name: Change Management Risk
CC3.4.description: The organization identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

requirements.name: Change Management Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Change Management Policy that outlines how risks associated with changes are evaluated.

requirements.name: Change Risk Assessment Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for assessing the impact of changes and planning mitigations for associated risks.

requirements.name: Change Risk Documentation
requirements.description: Change impact assessments, risk logs, and management approval records.

CC4.1.name: Control Monitoring
CC4.1.description: The organization selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

requirements.name: Information Security Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that outlines monitoring requirements for internal controls.

requirements.name: Control Testing Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for ongoing and periodic testing of internal controls.

requirements.name: Control Testing Documentation
requirements.description: Internal audit reports, control testing records, and management review documentation.

CC4.2.name: Deficiency Management
CC4.2.description: The organization evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action.

requirements.name: Risk Management Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Risk Management Policy that establishes a framework for identifying, reporting, and remediating control deficiencies.

requirements.name: Deficiency Management Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for documenting, tracking, and remediating control deficiencies.

requirements.name: Deficiency Management Records
requirements.description: Deficiency logs, remediation plans, and follow-up audit reports.

CC5.1.name: Control Selection
CC5.1.description: The organization selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.

requirements.name: Information Security Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that outlines criteria for the design and selection of controls.

requirements.name: Control Implementation Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for developing, documenting, and implementing controls to mitigate risks.

requirements.name: Control Implementation Records
requirements.description: Control design documents, implementation records, and risk mitigation assessments.

CC5.2.name: Technology Controls
CC5.2.description: The organization selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

requirements.name: Information Security Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that specifies baseline security configurations and technology management practices.

requirements.name: Technology Control Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for implementing and monitoring technology controls such as firewalls, antivirus, and system hardening.

requirements.name: Technology Control Records
requirements.description: System configuration records, monitoring reports, and technology audit logs.

CC5.3.name: Policy Implementation
CC5.3.description: The organization deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and procedures that put policies into action.

requirements.name: Corporate Governance Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Corporate Governance Policy that outlines how policies are communicated, enforced, and monitored.

requirements.name: Policy Implementation Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for operationalizing policies including documentation, training, and compliance monitoring.

requirements.name: Policy Implementation Records
requirements.description: Policy distribution records, training logs, and compliance monitoring reports.

CC6.1.name: Access Security
CC6.1.description: The organization implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Access Control Policy that defines controls for network and system access including segmentation and firewalls.

requirements.name: Access Management Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for granting, monitoring, and revoking system access including access logging and periodic reviews.

requirements.name: Access Control Records
requirements.description: Access control configurations, firewall logs, and system access review reports.

CC6.2.name: Access Authentication
CC6.2.description: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the organization registers and authorizes new internal and external users.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Access Control Policy requiring strong authentication methods including passwords and multi-factor authentication.

requirements.name: Authentication Management Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for user registration, credential issuance, and ongoing authentication management.

requirements.name: Authentication Records
requirements.description: Authentication logs, MFA configuration records, and user account management records.

CC6.3.name: Access Removal
CC6.3.description: The organization removes access to protected information assets when appropriate.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Access Control Policy detailing prompt revocation of user access upon termination or role change.

requirements.name: Access Removal Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for de-provisioning user access immediately after termination or role change.

requirements.name: Access Removal Records
requirements.description: User termination logs, de-provisioning records, and access review reports.

CC6.4.name: Access Review
CC6.4.description: The organization evaluates and manages access to protected information assets on a periodic basis.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Access Control Policy mandating periodic reviews of user access rights and privileges.

requirements.name: Access Review Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for conducting regular access reviews and validating that user permissions align with current roles.

requirements.name: Access Review Records
requirements.description: Access review logs, user access reports, and management sign-off documentation.

CC6.5.name: System Account Management
CC6.5.description: The organization identifies and authenticates system users, devices, and other systems before allowing access.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Access Control Policy that defines processes for creating, maintaining, and terminating system accounts.

requirements.name: Account Management Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for provisioning system accounts, managing privileged access, and monitoring account activity.

requirements.name: Account Management Records
requirements.description: Account provisioning logs, privileged account review reports, and system audit logs.

CC6.6.name: Access Restrictions
CC6.6.description: The organization restricts physical access to facilities and protected information assets.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Access Control Policy that establishes requirements for securing facilities and restricting physical entry to sensitive areas.

requirements.name: Physical Access Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for issuing physical access credentials, managing visitor access, and monitoring facility entry.

requirements.name: Physical Access Records
requirements.description: Facility access logs, visitor sign-in records, and security camera reports.

CC6.7.name: Information Asset Changes
CC6.7.description: The organization manages changes to system components to minimize the risk of unauthorized changes.

requirements.name: Change Management Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Change Management Policy that governs modifications to information assets.

requirements.name: Change Management Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for managing, reviewing, and approving changes to information assets, including rollback measures.

requirements.name: Change Management Records
requirements.description: Change logs, approval records, and configuration management documentation.

CC6.8.name: Malicious Software Prevention
CC6.8.description: The organization implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software.

requirements.name: Information Security Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that requires the use of antivirus, anti-malware, and threat detection solutions.

requirements.name: Malware Prevention Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for scanning, detecting, and responding to malware incidents on endpoints and networks.

requirements.name: Malware Prevention Records
requirements.description: Antivirus logs, malware detection alerts, and remediation records.

CC7.1.name: Infrastructure Monitoring
CC7.1.description: To detect and act upon security events in a timely manner, the organization monitors system capacity, security threats, and vulnerabilities.

requirements.name: Information Security Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that outlines monitoring requirements for infrastructure and systems.

requirements.name: Infrastructure Monitoring Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for real-time monitoring of infrastructure performance, security events, and system vulnerabilities.

requirements.name: Infrastructure Monitoring Records
requirements.description: Monitoring tool reports, alert logs, and incident tracking records.

CC7.2.name: Security Event Response
CC7.2.description: The organization designs, develops, and implements policies and procedures to respond to security incidents and breaches.

requirements.name: Incident Response Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Incident Response Policy that defines roles, responsibilities, and procedures for addressing security events.

requirements.name: Security Incident Response Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for detecting, containing, eradicating, and recovering from security incidents.

requirements.name: Incident Response Records
requirements.description: Incident logs, response drill reports, and post-incident review documentation.

CC7.3.name: Security Event Recovery
CC7.3.description: The organization implements recovery procedures to ensure timely restoration of systems or assets affected by security incidents.

requirements.name: Business Continuity Policy
requirements.description: Reference to the Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Policy that outlines strategies for restoring systems and data.

requirements.name: Recovery Procedures
requirements.description: Procedures for restoring systems and data following a security incident, including backup restoration and validation.
Recovery test results, restoration logs, and incident recovery reports.

CC7.4.name: Security Event Analysis
CC7.4.description: The organization implements incident response activities to identify root causes of security incidents and develop remediation plans.

requirements.description: Reference to the Incident Response Policy that requires root cause analysis for security incidents.
Procedures for conducting root cause analysis and developing remediation plans for recurring issues.
Incident analysis reports, lessons learned documentation, and remediation tracking records.

CC7.5.name: Security Event Communication
CC7.5.description: The organization identifies, develops, and implements activities to communicate security incidents to affected parties.

requirements.description: Reference to the Incident Response Policy that defines processes for internal and external incident notifications.
Procedures for timely communication of security incidents to stakeholders, regulators, and internal teams.
Communication logs, notifications, and records of stakeholder communications during incidents.

CC8.1.name: Change Authorization
CC8.1.description: The organization authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures.

requirements.description: Reference to the Change Management Policy that establishes controls for reviewing, approving, and documenting changes.
Procedures for submitting, reviewing, and approving changes, including emergency change processes.
Change request logs, approval records, and post-change review reports.

CC9.1.name: Business Continuity Planning
CC9.1.description: The organization identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover critical information technology resources.

requirements.description: Reference to the Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Policy that outlines recovery objectives, strategies, and responsibilities.
Procedures for conducting business impact analyses, backup operations, and disaster recovery testing.
Business continuity plans, BIA reports, and disaster recovery test results.

CC9.2.name: Vendor Risk Management
CC9.2.description: The organization assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

requirements.description: Reference to the Vendor Risk Management Policy outlining criteria for vendor selection, risk assessment, and ongoing monitoring.
Procedures for assessing vendor risk through questionnaires, audits, and continuous monitoring.
Vendor risk assessment reports, due diligence records, and contract reviews.

CC9.9.name: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Testing
CC9.9.description: The organization tests business continuity and disaster recovery plans, evaluates the test results, and updates the plans accordingly.

requirements.description: Reference to the Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Policy that defines testing frequency, methodologies, and remediation procedures.
Procedures for conducting regular BC/DR tests and documenting test results with follow-up actions.
Test reports, remediation logs, and updated BC/DR plans.

A1.1.name: Availability Commitments
A1.1.description: The entity maintains commitments to ensure systems are available for operation.

requirements.description: Reference to the Availability Policy that outlines uptime, performance, and service level requirements.
Procedures for monitoring system availability, reporting outages, and ensuring continuity of operations.
Uptime reports, incident logs, and SLA monitoring records.

A1.2.name: Capacity Planning
A1.2.description: The entity monitors and manages system capacity to meet demands.

requirements.description: Reference to the Availability Policy defining procedures for monitoring, forecasting, and managing system capacity.
Procedures for capacity analysis, resource allocation, and performance tuning.
Capacity reports, trend analysis, and resource utilization logs.

A1.3.name: Incident Recovery
A1.3.description: The entity has controls to restore system availability after incidents.

requirements.description: Reference to the Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Policy that outlines procedures to restore services after an outage.
Procedures for incident response, recovery, and restoration of systems after an outage.
Incident recovery test results, post-incident reviews, and restoration logs.

C1.1.name: Confidential Information Classification
C1.1.description: The entity classifies information to identify and protect confidential information.

requirements.description: Reference to the Data Classification Policy that outlines classification levels and handling requirements for confidential information.
Procedures for classifying, labeling, and handling confidential information.
Data classification records, labeling practices, and access control lists for confidential information.

C1.2.name: Access Restrictions for Confidential Data
C1.2.description: The entity restricts access to confidential information on a need-to-know basis.

requirements.description: Reference to the Data Classification Policy which includes controls for restricting access to confidential information.
Procedures for granting, monitoring, and revoking access to confidential data based on need-to-know.
Access logs, periodic access reviews, and certification records.

C1.3.name: Confidential Data Disposal
C1.3.description: The entity securely disposes of confidential information when no longer needed.

requirements.description: Reference to the Data Classification Policy which includes provisions for secure data disposal.
Procedures for secure data destruction and disposal (electronic and physical).
Disposal records, certificates of destruction, and audit logs.

PI1.1.name: Accuracy and Completeness
PI1.1.description: The entity ensures data is processed accurately and completely.

requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that addresses data accuracy and completeness.
Procedures for validating data inputs and outputs to ensure completeness and accuracy.
Data validation reports, exception logs, and audit records.

PI1.2.name: Input, Processing, and Output Controls
PI1.2.description: The entity validates the completeness and accuracy of data throughout processing.

requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that outlines controls over data processing.
Procedures for ensuring proper validation, error handling, and reconciliation during data processing.
Data processing logs, validation reports, and exception handling records.

PI1.3.name: Exception Handling
PI1.3.description: The entity identifies and resolves processing exceptions in a timely manner.

requirements.description: Reference to the Information Security Policy that outlines procedures for handling processing exceptions.
Procedures for detecting exceptions, escalating issues, and documenting resolutions.
Exception logs, resolution documentation, and process improvement records.

P1.1.name: Privacy Notice
P1.1.description: The entity provides notice about the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information.

requirements.description: Reference to the Privacy Policy that informs individuals about personal data collection, usage, and disclosure practices.
Procedures for distributing and updating the privacy notice.
Copies of the privacy notice, version history, and distribution logs.

P1.2.name: Choice and Consent
P1.2.description: The entity obtains consent for personal information where required by policy or law.

requirements.description: Reference to the Privacy Policy that requires explicit consent for the collection and processing of personal data.
Procedures for obtaining, recording, and managing individual consent.
Consent records, opt-in logs, and audit trails for consent management.

P1.3.name: Data Retention and Disposal
P1.3.description: The entity retains personal information for only as long as needed and disposes of it securely.

requirements.description: Reference to the Privacy Policy that defines retention periods and secure disposal methods for personal data.
Procedures for reviewing, archiving, and securely disposing of personal data.
Retention schedules, disposal logs, and certificates of data destruction.
